instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Cycles every 4 seconds on 3 ports 5V. Only 1 port is stuck on 5V
threads.message:
Hi everyone.
Need help here, please.

Liquid damaged around <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>/<CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and UB300.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> shorted – CB300 faulty and replaced.

 I have already checked all rails on page 120 and 121 for shorts and all rails are fine.

2 Caps replaced as it was bad corroded.
<CAPACITOR>C3108</CAPACITOR> - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL>
<CAPACITOR>C3100</CAPACITOR> - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>

Only port that 5V is not cycling is <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>
All the other 3 ports are cycling.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0V not pulsing
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.41 and cycling

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Cycles every 4 seconds on 3 ports 5V. Only 1 port is stuck on 5V
threads.message:
Compare voltage and diode mode readings on LDOs of all <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
May need to change <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Cycles every 4 seconds on 3 ports 5V. Only 1 port is stuck on 5V
threads.message:
Checked all LDOs lines on all chips and diode values are OK.
After start to remove the Black glue around the <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, I found corrosion on <RESISTOR>R3108</RESISTOR> side 1.
<RESISTOR>R3108</RESISTOR> replaced.

All works amazingly fine.
Thanks 2informaticos
